New Records: Spencer Strider reached a milestone with his nine strikeouts, and he now has 424 strikeouts in his first 50 career starts, the most since 1893.
Key Match Events: Austin Riley hit a two-run homer in the first to open up the scoring, and he also hit a sacrifice fly in the third to bring in Ronald Acuña Jr.
Left fielder Kevin Pillar doubled in the fourth to score Marcell Ozuna
Reliever Kirby Yates struck out Brandon Marsh to end the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves were up 16 games on the Phillies coming into tonight's game, and no NL East team has been within five games of the Braves since June 14 or within 10 since July 19
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker said 'We've checked one box'
Ronald Acuña Jr. responded to booing fans by raising both arms and signaling with his hands to bring it on
Spencer Strider said 'Now the real party starts'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves clinched their sixth straight NL East title and their 18th as a franchise
The six straight playoff appearances are the second-most in franchise history
The Braves own the best record in baseball
This is their sixth straight division title and their 18th as a franchise
The Braves have gone nearly wire-to-wire in the 2023 season
The Braves took special satisfaction in clinching on the same Citizens Bank Park field where the Phillies eliminated them last October in the NL Division Series
